[ C ] a narrow hole that is dug into the ground: A workman was killed when the sides of the trench he was working in collapsed.
[ C usually plural ] a deep hole dug by soldiers and used as a place from which they can attack the enemy while being hidden: the trenches of the First World War trench warfare Compare
